result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Traywick was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment recommended within 20 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  This agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole, regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.
Defendant eligible for expungement of count 1 only if probation is successfully completed and he has no new charges.

Comply with any conditions, rules and assessments per agent.

Undergo an AODA assessment and comply with all recommendations from the assessment.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Defendant not ordered to pay DNA surcharge.
Defendant to continue full time employment or combination of education and employment equivalent to full time.

No consumption or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name and must take exactly as directed to be taken.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Not associate with known drug dealers, known drug users or their residences.  

Not to be present where controlled substances are used or illegally sold.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Comply with all conditions and rules established by his agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
With work release privileges
